message_1:
Calculate the standard enthalpy of formation of carbon dioxide (CO2) using the following information:

C(graphite) + O2(g) -> CO2(g), ΔH° = -393.5 kJ/mol
C(graphite) + 2H2(g) -> CH4(g), ΔH° = -74.8 kJ/mol
2H2(g) + O2(g) -> 2H2O(l), ΔH° = -572.0 kJ/mol
message_2:
The standard enthalpy of formation of carbon dioxide (CO2) is already given in the first reaction:

C(graphite) + O2(g) -> CO2(g), ΔH° = -393.5 kJ/mol

Therefore, the standard enthalpy of formation of CO2 is -393.5 kJ/mol.
